p.s: The quotation The limits of my language are the limits of my world by Ludwig Wittgenstein, a germanGerman linguistic philosopher means probably that language is one of the most important things in life.
We can only communicate with language and communicating is essential for expressing our thoughts and feelings, so that other people can understand us.
Furthermore the metaphor with the word world could be used because it's a worldwide topic and worldwide international communication in limited by the language.

He seems to broaden his horizons only with the help of language because it's all about meeting new challangeschallenges and and gaining different opportunities for which language is the key in the most situations of this globalized world.
I personally agree with this statement and think that Wittgenstein brought the meaning of it on point and for everyone to understand.
